about.title: All About KeMU
about.summary: Kenya Methodist University is a Chartered Christian University with main campus in Meru and additional campuses in Nairobi and Mombasa. The university offers PhD, Masters, Degree, Diploma, and Certificate programmes. KeMU has over 32,000 alumni and is the first and only private university in Kenya to graduate medical doctors. The university focuses on market-driven courses, industry linkages, and opportunities outside the classroom.

about.title: Our History
about.summary: Kenya Methodist University (KeMU) is a Christian chartered private university founded by the Methodist Church in Kenya (MCK). The Church first established Kaaga Rural Training Centre for agricultural training, then the Methodist Training Institute (MTI) for training ministers. In 1984, the Church decided to establish a university in Kaaga, Meru. A committee was formed in 1987 to develop modalities. The Commission for Higher Education (CHE) granted a Letter of Interim Authority in June 1997, and KeMU became a chartered university in June 2006 when granted a Charter by President Mwai Kibaki.

governance.title: University Senate
governance.summary: The University Senate consists of the Vice-Chancellor (who serves as Chairman), the Deputy Vice-Chancellor, the principal of each constituent college, the Deans of the faculties, institutes and schools, the Chairman of the teaching departments, the Librarian, one representative of each faculty board, the professors of the University, two members elected by the students' organization (with restrictions on confidential matters), and any other members as provided for in the statutes. The Senate has powers to satisfy itself regarding the content and academic standard of courses, propose regulations for admission and examination standards, decide which persons have attained the prescribed standard of proficiency for degrees, diplomas, certificates or other awards, initiate proposals relating to the conduct of the University, and make regulations governing matters within its powers.

governance.title: The University Chancellor
governance.summary: According to The Universities Act 2012, the Chancellor is the titular head of the University and confers degrees, grants diplomas, certificates and other awards in the name of the University. The Chancellor may recommend visitations to the Cabinet Secretary (public universities) or Board of Trustees (private universities), give advice to the Council, and enjoys powers and privileges as provided in the Charter. The Presiding Bishop of the Methodist Church in Kenya serves as the Chancellor. Currently, Rev. Isiah Deye holds this position.

governance.title: The Office of the Vice Chancellor
governance.summary: The Vice-Chancellor is appointed by the University Council in accordance with the University Charter. The Vice-Chancellor is the Chief Executive of the University and serves as the academic and administrative head with overall responsibility for the direction, organization, administration and programmes of the University. Responsibilities include directing, promoting and coordinating university activities; being responsible for academic, administrative, financial and development matters; serving as the accounting officer; acting as the University's representative and spokesperson in external relations; and serving as an ex-officio member of the Council. Currently, Rev. Prof. John Kobia Ataya, Ph.D serves as Vice-Chancellor.

governance.summary: The Office of the Deputy Vice Chancellor for Finance and Administration is responsible for the managerial and financial aspects of the university, including administration, finance, development and planning functions, and all aspects of the day-to-day running of KeMU. The division provides exceptional service and stewardship of the University's financial, human and physical resources. Functions include managing payroll, capital projects, student accounts, employee benefits, information services, food services, campus maintenance and landscaping, budgeting, and campus and environmental safety. The division strives to become a trusted advisor, providing exemplary service to support the academic, research and community engagement mission of the University. Core values include integrity, teamwork through mutual respect and fairness, and excellence in service and innovation. Currently led by Dr. Eliab Seroney Some, Ph.D as DVC.

tvet.title: KeMU TVET Institute
tvet.summary: KeMU TVET Institute is an Approved and Licensed Training Institute by TVET Authority (Registration Number: TVETA/PRIVATE/TVC/0042/2021AI). The institute's vision is to be a Centre of excellence in Competence Based Education and Training providing Holistic nurturing to inspire innovation and self-reliance. The mission is to provide quality Competency Based Education and Training that recognizes and nurtures the potential of each learner towards achieving higher standards of Excellence. The motto is 'Dreams are still valid.' The institute offers Diploma Courses (Level 6), Craft Certificate Courses (Level 5), Artisan Certificate Courses (Level 4), and Professional Short Courses. Diploma courses include Accountancy, Business Management, Project Management, Human Resource Management, Procurement & Supplies Management, ICT Technician, Library and Information Science, Social Work and Community Development, Community Health, Agricultural Extension, Horticulture Production and Processing, Food and Beverage Sales and Services, Human Nutrition & Dietitics, Tourism and Travel Management, Criminial Justice & Security management, Counselling Psychology, and Maritime Transport and Logistics (KMA Approved). Craft Certificate courses include Business Management, ICT Technician, Records and Archives Management, Social Work and Community Development, Community Health, Horticulture Production, Food and Beverage Sales and Services, Tourism and Travel Management, International Relations, Kenyan Sign language, and Maritime Transport and Logistics (KMA Approved). Artisan certificate courses include Office assistance. Professional Short Courses include CDL, CISCO (CCNA 1,2,3,4), Kenyan Sign Language (KSL), Foreign Languages (French, German), Music (Keyboard, Guitar, Set Drums, and Vocals), and KASNEB courses.

directorates.title: Directorate of Research and Innovation
directorates.summary: The Directorate of Research, Community Outreach and Industry Linkages is mandated to coordinate all research activities in the University, fundraise for research activities, coordinate grant writing activities, and disseminate scientific research through the International Journal of Professional Publication (IJPP) and annual scientific conferences. The directorate supports students and staff members to improve their research skills through continuous capacity building. Academic staff are engaged in research activities in thematic areas including Business, Health Sciences, Social Sciences, Religious studies, Mathematics, Agriculture and Food Security, Microbiology and Molecular Biology, Ecology, Education, Organic and applied Chemistry, Energy, and Climate Change. The Directorate has continuously ensured that University products and services exceptionally surpass set standards, creating a culture of evidence-based decision making and teamwork. Achievements include automating class attendance tools, automating evaluation of teaching and learning tools, and embarking on ISO 9001:2015 certification processes. student_services.title: Guidance and Counselling
student_services.summary: The well-being of students is taken very seriously at Kenya Methodist University. Across all campuses, welfare, chaplaincy and counseling services are available, managed by highly qualified staff. The counselling center works closely with students, Peer Counsellors, the Dean of Students, Academic Affairs Division, Health Clinic, Security, Clubs, Sports Tutor/Sports Groups, and Academic Departments, as well as external partners, government and non-governmental organizations, and corporates. The vision is to become a trusted, visible and inclusive University Counselling Center that continually strives to enhance the mental health and overall well-being of students and the larger university community. The mission is to support the university vision by creating an environment that promotes student growth and development through direct counselling services, psycho-education and awareness programmes. Services include confidential counselling, specialized therapeutic assistance for academic challenges and mental health issues, consultation, prevention services, and outreach. All counselling sessions are confidential unless there is a proven threat to life.

student_services.title: Student Life
student_services.summary: A student of Kenya Methodist University is exposed to a variety of curricula and extra-curricula activities. Sports disciplines include Soccer, Netball, Basketball, Volleyball, Rugby, Handball, Lawn Tennis, Table Tennis, Badminton, Karate, Taekwondo, Swimming, Chess, Scrabble and Hockey. The Sports and Games Department provides high-quality sporting and recreational services for all students and staff. The Department of Health Service offers Outpatient Services, Preventive Health Services, Curative Services, Promotive Health Services, Referral Services, and Observations. Students can join and form clubs to pursue their passions and explore new interests. All hostels are Wi-Fi enabled. The Cultural Festival includes the Mr. and Miss KeMU beauty pageant. The goal is to produce the next generation of professional and transformational leaders who will inspire positive change in society.

student_services.title: Scholarships
student_services.summary: Kenya Methodist University offers the 'Bless to Bless' scholarship program, providing a variety of scholarships and fellowships designed to help students and their families pay for university. Scholarships and grants are types of gift aid that do not have to be repaid. Requirements include being a full-time student (at least 12 points), applying for financial aid on time, meeting Satisfactory Academic Progress standards, and having approximately the same amount of financial need as in prior years. news.title: Alumni
news.summary: The Kenya Methodist University Alumni Association (KeMU-AA) is a dynamic, diverse, and empowered community of graduates who embody excellence, service, and innovation. Established to unite alumni from all walks of life, the Association plays a vital role in strengthening lifelong relationships, promoting professional growth, and advancing the vision of Kenya Methodist University. With members across Kenya, Africa, and the world, KeMU-AA stands as a network of innovators, leaders, entrepreneurs, scholars, changemakers, and community builders. The Association's guiding philosophy is 'Laborare est Orare — To Work is to Pray.' The mission is to cultivate a proactive and engaged alumni community that contributes to member development, supports KeMU's mission, and creates meaningful impact through mentorship, collaboration, innovation, and service. The vision is to be a globally recognized alumni community that inspires leadership, fosters excellence, and champions the advancement of KeMU and the communities served.

The vision is to revolutionize the eLearning platform into a globally competitive Digital Campus that facilitates online teaching and learning while nurturing the next generation of professionals and visionary leaders. contacts.title: KeMU Security Operations
contacts.summary: KeMU Security Operations ensures, as far as is reasonably practicable, the security and safety of all students, staff, visitors and contractors whilst within or situated on university premises. Keeping the campus community safe is a top priority, addressing the most pressing safety and security concerns in and around the campus. Security and personal safety is everyone's responsibility. The Security Office is responsible for effective operation and enforcement of Security Policy and Procedures. Functions include supporting overall security management, managing security intelligence, conducting safety and security awareness training, conducting internal investigations, enforcing university policies and procedures, planning fire drills and emergency preparedness, supporting risk and disaster management, carrying out security risk surveys, and liaising with relevant stakeholders. The university uses CCTV surveillance in critical areas, manned 24/7 by security personnel. Contact: kemu.security@kemu.ac.ke
